title: Talks (a selection of)
text: Only including those in which I was doing the talking.

title: Talks (a selection of)
text:
Conference Presentations



McCall, C. & Winter, S. D. (2022, July). Using intersectional research methods to examine intervention efficacy. Roundtable Discussion presented at the Annual Conference of the International School Psychology Association (ISPA), Leuven, Belgium.
Winter, S. D. & Depaoli, S. (2021, July). Detecting Misspecification in Latent Growth Models with Bayesian Fit Indices. Talk presented at the International Meeting of the Psychometric Society (IMPS).
Winter, S. D. & Smid, S. (2019, May). Demonstration of an Online Educational Application on Bayesian Default Priors. In R. van de Schoot (chair) Risks of Default Priors in Bayesian Structural Equation Models with Small Samples and Two Approaches on How to Avoid Those Risks. Talk presented at the 31st APS Annual Convention, Washington, DC.
Winter, S. D. & Lek, K. M. (2018, July). Bayesian Approximate Measurement Invariance: For Those Times When You Have Too Little or Too Much Data. Talk presented at VIII European Congress of Methodology, Jena, Germany.

title: Talks (a selection of)
text:
Invited Talks/Workshops
Winter, S. D. (2022, April). Assessing prior-data disagreement in Bayesian SEM. Invited webinar presented at Young Statisticians Europe (YSE). A recorded version of this webinar can be found here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cuwhzd-8z4k
Winter, S. D.* (2022, March). Creating Dynamic Reports from your Shiny App. Invited talk presented at R-Ladies St. Louis. A recorded version of this webinar can be found here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MvGAstDzLJk

title: Sonja D. Winter
text:
I am an assistant professor in the Statistics, Measurement, and Evaluation in Education program at the College of Education and Human Development of the University of Missouri.
Specific research interests include:

Bayesian methods
Structural equation modeling
Longitudinal data
Measurement

You can find an overview of my publications and talks by clicking on the links above. You can also look at my full CV.


 Back to top

title: Publications
text:
Bonifay W., Winter, S. D., Skoblow, H., & Watts. A. (revise & resubmit). Good fit is not a Sufficient Indicator of Replication Success. [Invited contribution to special issue of Assessment on “Assessment, Measurement, and Registered Replication.”]
Depaoli, S., Winter, S. D., & Liu, H. (revise & resubmit). Under-Fitting and Over-Fitting: The Performance of Bayesian Model Selection and Fit Indices in SEM. Structural Equation Modeling: A Multidisciplinary Journal.
Merkle, E., Ariyo, O., Garnier-Villarreal, M., & Winter, S. D. (revise & resubmit). Opaque Prior Distributions in Bayesian SEM. Methodology.
Parmenter, J. G. & Winter, S. D. (in press). Inequity within the LGBTQ+ Community as a Distal Stressor: An Extension of Minority Stress Theory. Psychology of Sexual Orientation and Gender Diversity.
